intro: Acer obtusatum subsp. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth-leaf maple, is a deciduous tree native to eastern North America. It typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters with a broad, spreading crown. The leaves are palmately lobed, with a smooth, waxy surface that becomes slightly hairy when young. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers in early spring followed by winged seeds in the fall. This species is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forests and along streambanks.
